title: Bug: `key-spacing` with `align: "value"` produces incorrect alignment

labels.name: accepted
labels.description: There is consensus among the team that this change meets the criteria for inclusion

labels.name: archived due to age
labels.description: This issue has been archived; please open a new issue for any further discussion

body:
### Environment

Node version: v19.0.0
npm version: v8.19.2
Local ESLint version: v8.26.0
Global ESLint version: Not found
Operating System: darwin 22.1.0

### What parser are you using?

Default (Espree)

### What did you do?

```js
/* eslint "key-spacing": ["error", { align: "value" }] */
var foo =
{
  code: 1,
  message:
  "some value on the next line",
};
```

[**DEMO**](https://eslint.org/play/#)

### What did you expect to happen?

No error.

### What actually happened?

Got error
> 4:9  Missing space before value for key 'code'.  ([key-spacing](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/key-spacing))

Autofix adds three spaces after `code:` to align the value `1` one space after `message:`, which doesn't seem correct since there is no other value to align with.

If the order of the properties is swapped, as expected, no error is reported.

```js
/* eslint "key-spacing": ["error", { align: "value" }] */
var foo =
{
  message:
  "some value on the next line",
  code: 1
};
```

[**DEMO**](https://eslint.org/play/#)

### Participation

- [X] I am willing to submit a pull request for this issue.

### Additional comments

_No response_
